data.meta_description: Native to most of North and South America, Heliotropium curassavicum (Salt Heliotrope) is a perennial plant in its native habitat but is usually grown as an annual in colder climates. It is a sprawling plant with much-branched stems and fleshy, lance-shaped, bluish-green leaves that are thinly covered with a whitish powder. Tiny white flowers with yellow throats are produced along a gradually uncoiling stalk from spring to fall.
